DOC.brief_summary: We aim to study the efficacy of Acupuncture versus sham acupuncture in children with ASD.
DOC.brief_title: Randomized Controlled Trial of Acupuncture Versus Sham Acupuncture in Autistic Spectrum Disorder
DOC.detailed_description: In Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) philosophy, the approach to Autistic Spectrum Disorder (ASD) is a holistic one. The objective is to study the efficacy of a short intensive course of Acupuncture versus sham acupuncture in improving the overall functional status of children with autism. A single-blind randomized control trial was conducted in 50 children. These children were randomly assigned to Treatment group with Tongue Acupuncture (40 sessions over 8 weeks) or Control group (Sham Tongue Acupuncture to non-acupoints in the tongue).
DOC.criteria: Subjects with diagnosis of autism made according to the criteria of the 4th edition of the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSMIV) and Autism Diagnostic InterviewRevised and with a score for Childhood Autism Rating Scale (CARS) greater than 30. Children with associated neurological disorders and epilepsy.
